title: the guyman

fields.name: Abilities:
fields.value:
- Write an overly complicated version of a role. (min 2x original character count, or 1900 characters, whichever is smaller. If the role was already >1500 characters, this fails. the flavor text of the new version of the role must also be less than a third of the role's length.) The host may make up to 2 changes to make it balanced. If that role is in play, that player becomes the new role. If that role is not in play, the host chooses the closest possible player to that role to become that role
- Space out, allowing you to do an additional use of your first ability next night. Only usable if you don't have a buff for killing the role's namesake

fields.name: Attributes:
fields.value: - If the player this role is named after (which at the time of creating this role is <@563491765576007680>, display name the guyman, and current nick name on Grand Idea Mafia being Night Fall) dies, the host only makes one change to the new role. (As a result, the balancing effect is lessened)

fields.name: Goal:
fields.value: Eliminate everyone who doesn't actually exist

desc:
Post 5492
*Oh god here they are again with another long as fuck overcomplicated role, at this point I kind of want them to make the flavor text overtly long for no foreseeable reason so that there is less space to fit dumb as fuck abilities as they don't have nitro and have a character cap of 2000. Wouldn't that be so awesome? Wouldn't that be so cool? Wouldn't it be nice to have a role that doesn't require reading a whole novel just to understand how the role works in the first place?*
